BSCcore
Class BSCObject

java.lang.Object
  BSCcore.BSCObject

public class BSCObject
extends java.lang.Object

BSCObject implements a single data "object" in the BiSciCol system (e.g., specimen, tissue sample, collecting event, etc.). Each object has several properties associated with it, such as date last modified and type (implemented as RDF literal values), and each object is connected to 0 or more other objects in the underlying model. BSCObjects are aware of these relationships and can allow traversal of their siblings, ancestors, or descendents.

Constructor Detail

BSCObject

public BSCObject(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode node,
                 com.hp.hpl.jena.shared.PrefixMapping prefixmap)
Construct a new BSCObject from a Jena RDFNode object.

Parameters:
node - The underlying Jena RDFNode that holds the data for this BSCObject.
prefixmap - The prefix mapping to use when building short-form strings.
Method Detail

isLiteral

public boolean isLiteral()
Tell us if this is object is a literal in the underlying RDF graph. Note that this generally should not happen unless a literal object is accessed directly in the BSCModel.

Returns:
True if this object is a literal, false otherwise.

getType

public java.lang.String getType()
Tell us what the rdf:type is of this object.

Returns:
A string with the literal rdf:type of this object.

getDateLastModified

public org.joda.time.DateTime getDateLastModified()
Tell us what the dwc:DateLastModified is of this object.

Returns:
A joda DateTime object containing the parsed value of the literal dwc:DateLastModified for this object.

getDateLastModifiedString

public java.lang.String getDateLastModifiedString()
A convenience method that returns the value of dwc:DateLastModified for this object as a string instead of a DateTime object. It is essentially equivalent to object.getDateLastModified().toString(format), where format is yyyy-MM-dd.

Returns:
A string containing the value of the literal dwc:DateLastModified for this object in yyyy-MM-dd format.

getGeo

public java.lang.String getGeo()
Get the geographic location of this object. This is a relation in our Model, not really the same as DateLastModified since for now we're treating Geo as URN. For now, this method is unimplemented. It may be that this method doesn't make sense.

Returns:
For now, just returns null.

getURI

public java.lang.String getURI()
Gets the full URI for this object.

Returns:
A string containing the URI for this object.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Test if two BSCObjects are logically the same. If both objects resolve to the same URI, they are considered equal.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
obj - The object to test for equality.
Returns:
True if the objects are equivalent, false otherwise.

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Return an integer hash value for this BSCObject. Values returned will be semantically correct with regard to the equals() function. That is, equivalent objects will have equivalent hash values.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
An integer hash value for this object.

hasChildren

public boolean hasChildren()
Test whether or not this BSCObject has any immediate descendents. Immediate descendents are objects that are directly connected to this object via the leadsTo relationship.

Returns:
True if this BSCObject has 1 or more children, false otherwise.
See Also:
getChildren()

getChildren

public BSCObjBasicIter getChildren()
Get an iterator for all immediate descendents of this object. That is, return an iterator to all objects of RDF "leadsTo" statements for which this BSCObject is the subject.

Returns:
An iterator for all children of this BSCObject.
See Also:
hasChildren()

getDescendents

public BSCObjDescIter getDescendents(int depth)
Get an iterator for all descendents of this object up to and including the specified traversal depth. Objects are returned by the iterator in breadth-first traversal order. Thus, object.getDescendants(1) is semantically equivalent to object.getChildren().

Parameters:
depth - The maximum depth (inclusive) to traverse the graph.
Returns:
An iterator for all descendents of this BSCObject.
See Also:
getChildren(), visitDescendents(ModelVisitor), getRelatives()

getRelatives

public BSCObjBasicIter getRelatives()
Get an iterator for all relatives of this object. In this context, "relatives" means all objects that are connected to this BSCObject via relatedTo statements, either explicitly or via inferred triples. This method differs from the descendent-based methods in that no notion of the originally-specified object hierarchy is maintained; that is, multi- level relationships are essentially "flattened".

Returns:
An iterator for all relatives of this BSCObject.
See Also:
getChildren(), getDescendents(int), visitDescendents(ModelVisitor)

hasParents

public boolean hasParents()
Test whether or not this BSCObject has any immediate ancestors. Immediate ancestors are objects that are directly connected to this object via the "comesFrom" relationship.

Returns:
True if this BSCObject has 1 or more parents, false otherwise.
See Also:
getParent(), getParents()

getParent

public BSCObject getParent()
Get the immediate ancestor of this object. That is, if this BSCObject is the subject of a hasSource RDF statement, return the object of that statement. It this object has multiple parents, only one of them will be returned. In this situation, there are no guarantees about which particular parent is returned. This is a convenience method that is semantically equivalent to object.getParents().next().

Returns:
A parent of this BSCObject.
See Also:
hasParents(), getParents()

getParents

public BSCObjBasicIter getParents()
Get an iterator for all immediate ancestors of this object. That is, return an iterator to all objects of RDF "comesFrom" statements for which this BSCObject is the subject.

Returns:
An iterator for all parents of this BSCObject.
See Also:
hasParents(), getParent()

getSiblings

public BSCObjSiblingsIter getSiblings()
Get an iterator for all siblings of this object. Siblings are defined as all children of all parents of this BSCObject that are not equal to this BSCObject.

Returns:
An iterator for all siblings of this BSCObject.

visitDescendents

public void visitDescendents(ModelVisitor visitor)
Use the provided visitor to visit this object and its descendents. The traversal continues until visitor.visitEnter() returns false; this signals the maximum depth of the traversal. All descendents at that depth are visited. Descendents are visited in depth-first order.

Parameters:
visitor - The object to visit the descendents with.
See Also:
getChildren(), getDescendents(int), getRelatives()

visitAncestors

public void visitAncestors(ModelVisitor visitor)
Use the provided visitor to visit this object and its ancestors. The traversal continues until visitor.visitEnter() returns false; this signals the maximum depth of the traversal. All ancestors at that depth are visited. Ancestors are visited with a depth-first traversal.

Parameters:
visitor - The object to visit the ancestors with.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Get a text representation of the URI of this object. If possible, a namespace prefix is used to form a short string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A text representation of this BSCObject.
